title: Ticket #3794: glexec fails at Imperial College
description:
Condor fails to use glexec at Imperial College, because condor_glexec_setup sets GLEXEC_TARGET_PROXY to a path that does not exist. This script doesn't actually want a target proxy to be created. The ability to turn off the target proxy by setting GLEXEC_TARGET_PROXY=/dev/null has been supported since glexec 0.9 (beginning of 2012). We believe it is an acceptable solution to depend on that.

As far as I know, the only special thing about glexec configuration at Imperial is create_target_proxy=yes in glexec.conf.
remarks:
2013-Jul-19 13:59:56 by danb:
Actually, glexec at Imperial College seems to be very different from the norm. I have tested at sites with create_target_proxy=yes, and this alone does not trigger the problem. Imperial may be using an entirely different implementation of glexec.

I verified that the patch in condor that sets GLEXEC_TARGET_PROXY=/dev/null does successfully execute glexec jobs at Imperial.
